Line 31: Line 31:
The '''SheevaPlug''' is one of the first "[[Plug computer]]s" to be available on the market. It features a 1.2GHz Marvell Kirkwood 6281 [[ARM architecture|ARM]]-compatible CPU. The device has already been accredited as a "[[NSLU2]] killer" due to its low price (and the discontinued status of the NSLU2). <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.linuxtoday.com/news_story.php3?ltsn=2009-03-19-008-35-OS-HW-DV |title=SheevaPlug: the NSLU2 killer |publisher=Linux Today |date= |accessdate=2009-04-17}}</ref>
The '''SheevaPlug''' is one of the first "[[Plug computer]]s" to be available on the market. It features a 1.2GHz Marvell Kirkwood 6281 [[ARM architecture|ARM]]-compatible CPU. The device has already been accredited as a "[[NSLU2]] killer" due to its low price (and the discontinued status of the NSLU2). <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.linuxtoday.com/news_story.php3?ltsn=2009-03-19-008-35-OS-HW-DV |title=SheevaPlug: the NSLU2 killer |publisher=Linux Today |date= |accessdate=2009-04-17}}</ref>
â
The SheevaPlug runs on the [[Ubuntu]] Jaunty Jackalope 9.04 ARM build, available at the Ubuntu download site. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/marvell-sheevaplug-99-linux-pc-hidden-in-a-wall-wart-2435556/ |title=Marvell SheevaPlug: $99 Linux PC hidden in a Wall-Wart|publisher=Slash Gear|date=2009-02-24 |accessdate=2009-02-24}}</ref> The SheevaPlug has been supported since Kernel 2.6.27 and is currently shipping with 2.6.30-rc1 <ref>{{cite web|url=http://git.marvell.com/?p=orion.git;a=commit;h=577c9c456f0e1371cbade38eaf91ae8e8a308555 |title=Linus Torvalds posting of the 2.6.30-rc1 Kernel at the Marvell git site |publisher=Linus Torvalds |date=2009-04-07 |accessdate= }}</ref> The SheevaPlug supports both [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] and [[Linux]] direct serial via USB connection via its onboard mini USB [[JTAG]]. <ref> {{cite web|url=http://www.marvell.com/files/products/embedded_processors/developer/kirkwood/SheevaPlug%20Development%20Kit%20README-Rev1.2.pdf |title=SheevaPlug Developement Kit Readme file |date= |accessdate= }}</ref> Additionally Martin Michlmayr of Debian and HP's Open Source Program Office as an Open Source Community Expert has started working on a Debian specific port for Marvell's SheevaPlug. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://lists.debian.org/debian-arm/2009/02/msg00057.html |title=Update on Thecus N2100 support in Debian |publisher=Martin Michlmayr |date=2009-02-15 |accessdate=2009-02-15 }}</ref>
+
The SheevaPlug runs on the [[Ubuntu]] 9.04 ARM build, available at the Ubuntu download site. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/marvell-sheevaplug-99-linux-pc-hidden-in-a-wall-wart-2435556/ |title=Marvell SheevaPlug: $99 Linux PC hidden in a Wall-Wart|publisher=Slash Gear|date=2009-02-24 |accessdate=2009-02-24}}</ref> The SheevaPlug has been supported since Kernel 2.6.27 and is currently shipping with 2.6.30-rc1 <ref>{{cite web|url=http://git.marvell.com/?p=orion.git;a=commit;h=577c9c456f0e1371cbade38eaf91ae8e8a308555 |title=Linus Torvalds posting of the 2.6.30-rc1 Kernel at the Marvell git site |publisher=Linus Torvalds |date=2009-04-07 |accessdate= }}</ref> The SheevaPlug supports both [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] and [[Linux]] direct serial via USB connection via its onboard mini USB [[JTAG]]. <ref> {{cite web|url=http://www.marvell.com/files/products/embedded_processors/developer/kirkwood/SheevaPlug%20Development%20Kit%20README-Rev1.2.pdf |title=SheevaPlug Developement Kit Readme file |date= |accessdate= }}</ref> Additionally Martin Michlmayr of Debian and HP's Open Source Program Office as an Open Source Community Expert has started working on a Debian specific port for Marvell's SheevaPlug. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://lists.debian.org/debian-arm/2009/02/msg00057.html |title=Update on Thecus N2100 support in Debian |publisher=Martin Michlmayr |date=2009-02-15 |accessdate=2009-02-15 }}</ref>
